definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: She brought up the water, stopping at each landing to get her breath.
sentences.chinese: 她提水上楼，在每个楼梯平台处停下来喘口气。

sentences.english: John couldn't even pick up the box, much less carry it upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 约翰连这箱子提都提不起来，更别说把它搬上楼了。

sentences.english: Consecutive art space upstairs and downstairs is everyone's life stage.
sentences.chinese: 楼上楼下连贯的艺术空间，是每个人的生活舞台。

sentences.english: The old servant led Mr Utterson through the laboratory and up some stairs to the doctor's private study above.
sentences.chinese: 老仆人带他经过实验室，上楼来到博士的私人书房。

sentences.english: Moving up and down, it seems, always has its risks.
sentences.chinese: 上楼下楼之间，似乎，总是有它的危险。

sentences.english: But she took me upstairs, and attempted to get it out.
sentences.chinese: 但是她把我带上楼，试图把它弄出来。

sentences.english: Once the peony smile, also heel the Hui go upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 牡丹一笑，也就跟了阿慧上楼。

sentences.english: We manhandled the piano up the stairs.
I must call Behrman up to be my model for the old miner.
sentences.chinese: 我得叫贝尔曼上楼来给我当老矿工模特儿。

sentences.english: The boy, unable to see in dark, walked slowly upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩在伸手不见五指的黑暗中，慢慢地走上楼去。

sentences.english: She heard the carriage drive away as she proceeded up stairs.
sentences.chinese: 她上楼的时候，听到马车驶走的声音。

sentences.english: I cannot resist going up with this every night, and trying his door.
sentences.chinese: 我每天晚上总不能不带这个上楼，还要试试他的门。

sentences.english: He lost his balance and hurt himself when he went upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 他上楼时失去了平衡，摔伤了。

sentences.english: As Ham went out , I went upstairs to see poor Barkis.
sentences.chinese: 哈姆走后，我上楼去看可怜的巴克斯。

sentences.english: The corridor light bulb is broken, gu mother went upstairs had a fall.
sentences.chinese: 楼道里的灯泡坏了，顾妈妈上楼时摔了一跤。

sentences.english: I walkedupstairs to the third floor and knocked on his door.
sentences.chinese: 我走着上楼，上第三层后，敲了他的门。

definition: head of a flight of stairs
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
to get up/to leave/to set forth
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
